text:
Beverly is a city in Lincoln County, Kansas, United States. In 2010, 162 people lived there.
History.
Beverly was first settled in 1886. It was incorporated as a city in 1904. The city was named after Beverly, West Virginia, the hometown of an early settler.
Geography.
Beverly is at (39.014831, -97.974772). The United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
The 2010 census says that there were 162 people, 72 households, and 44 families living in Beverly.
Education.
Beverly is a part of USD 298 Lincoln.
Beverly schools were closed because of school unification. The Beverly High School mascot was Bobcats.
